abstract: Some leading lawmakers and military analysts are suggesting that splitting a $35 billion contract between Boeing and EADS-Northrop Grumman may be the only way to break an impasse.
snippet: Some leading lawmakers and military analysts are suggesting that splitting a $35 billion contract between Boeing and EADS-Northrop Grumman may be the only way to break an impasse.
lead_paragraph: During the last eight years, the Air Force has twice botched efforts to award one of the Pentagon’s richest contracts, a $35 billion order for tankers that can refuel warplanes in midair.

headline.main: U.S. May Let Rivals Share Tanker Deal
headline.print_headline: U.S. May Let Rivals Share Tanker Deal
